üìù Solution

This is a pretty simple challenge. The program first asks us to hand it a password and then reads a maximum of 255 bytes. The input is then ran through the ‚ÄúencryptInput‚Äù function and then compared against the stored password ‚ÄúvfwqUdvvrjwa476‚Äù. If the encrypted given password and the stored password are the same, a success message is shown to the user. The ‚ÄúencryptInput‚Äù function is a simple xor encryptor that loops over the characters of the string while XORing them with the value 0d5. Running the stored password through the decryptor will give us ‚ÄúsecretPassword123‚Äù.

Have a great day :) github.com/johnnnathan

üîë Keygen (Python)

input_string = "v`fw`qUdvvrjwa476"
xor_key = 5

xor_result = ''.join(chr(ord(char) ^ xor_key) for char in input_string)

print("Decrypted String: ", xor_result)
